intro: Hibiscus ankeranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Hibiscus ankeranensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations and potential ecological roles in its ecosystem.
